reviews.text: Great 3-night stay at this pleasant and well-located lodge. Family-owned, David was a great host. I'd happily stay here again.
reviews.title: Great place. Would stay again.
Our stay in Custer
reviews.text: ROOM: As a solo traveler I took the "small" #1 room near the lodge office. I found it to be comfortable, bright and well cared for with plenty of room. The bed was surprisingly nice and the bedding was soft. David keeps the rooms and bathrooms super clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION: Parking is easy and right at the end of the driveway. The lodge is located slightly out of town, about 2-3 minutes down the road. Though the property is near the road, I couldn't hear a thing from my room. The lodge looks onto some gorgeous peaks and deer graze in the evening along the wide lawns around the back.
reviews.title: twilite zone
Calamity Peak Lodge
reviews.text: PROPERTY: This is a simple, rustic lodge. If you're looking for higher-end amenities, you may not find Calamity to your liking. But if you're looking for a comfortable stay in a well-maintained accommodation that has character, you'll like this place. Each of the available rooms is slightly different and there're larger detached cabins for families - be sure to check the website for lots of photos of the options.
